text: Stanley J Wilson was a male athlete who competed for England. ==Athletics career== He competed for England in the javelin at the 1934 British Empire Games in London. Wilson was an early pioneer of the javelin in Britain, represented Birchfield Harriers and was the 1937 AAA champion. ==Personal life== He was a student and then a lecturer at Carnegie College of Physical Education, in Leeds and became a notable coach. ==References== Category:English male javelin throwers Category:Athletes (track and field) at the 1934 British Empire Games
title: Stanley Wilson (athlete)
